negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi alfonso, it looks like we have 2 books, 2 hats, and 1 ball to divide between us. I'm hoping we can find a fair split that we're both satisfied with. To start, I would propose that I take the ball and 1 book, and you can have the other book and the 2 hats. Let me know what you think of that as a starting point for discussion.

Bob replied in round 1: I'd suggest that I take the ball. I really need the ball. And I can then take 1 book or hat. You can take the remaining 3 items. You will end up with 3 items, while I only have 2. But let me have the ball.

Alice said in round 2: 
alfonso, I hear that the ball is very important to you and you value it highly. I want to make sure you get the item that matters most to you.

How about this - you take the ball, 1 book, and both hats. I will take just the other book. 

This way, you get the high-value ball plus 3 other items. I get less total items, but I'm okay with that because I know the ball is the key item for you.

I believe this division considers both our interests and puts the ball, the most important item, in your hands. It's less balanced in terms of number of items, but aims for a fair division of overall value.

Let me know if you would agree to this split. I want to make sure we find an allocation we both feel good about.
Bob replied in round 2: halt negotiation
guessed_bob_relative_value:
Items Alfonso values higher than you: ball
Items Alfonso values the same as you: book
Items Alfonso values less than you: hat
